Posts.Content: Oh and to the spotty chest I had that about day 10 in the evening- they just sprung up on my chest and shoulder. Went away though and were n't itchy or anything. Very odd xxxx
Posts.Title: May Chemo Club

Posts.Content: kazza. Ive been booked in for an MRI after my 3rd chemo already re: shrinkage. I'm 30 so mammograms don't show anything hence why I'm having an MRI. Xxxxx
Posts.Title: May Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Thank you on the hair everyone. I will be getting it shaved off im just thinking can I get away with it for few more days or are clumps going to fall out.  On the tingly hand thing. Its only when I apply pressure to them if washing them. I've been off the steroids for days now. I'm also taking anti- depressants so maybe its them. Back in for chemo 2 next week so I will just make sure I tell them.  Hope everyone is OK xxxxx
Posts.Title: May Chemo Club

Posts.Content: New to this so hope this appears in the May chemo club. I had my first chemo (FEC) on 5th May. I wonder if anyone else has had a side effect of tingly hands? This is when I wash them or put moisturiser on them. I'm trying to narrow this down to what could be the cause as I'm also on other medication. Thank you!
Posts.Title: May Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Thank you to replies about tingly hands :) I shall let the chemo team know. My hair started to fall out yesterday - just lots of strands :( scared to wash it now. Know its going to happen but would like to hang on it to it for the bank holiday weekend. Any ideas once it starts going how quickly it comes out- know we are all different. I'm on day 15 of First FEC. Next one is next Thursday. Lots of love everyone. Justine xxx
